docs.lead_paragraph: MERCANTILE LIBRARY.--We have noticed, with pleasure, at the desk of the Mercantile Library Association, a petition in favor of the early closing of that Institution on Saturdays. The long hours of business render some relaxation necessary to the health, as well as the comfort of its employees;...

docs.lead_paragraph: RESIGNATION OF JUDGE JEWEL.--Hon FREEBORN G. JEWETT has resigned his office of Justice of the Court of Appeals. The state of his health rendered retirement and repose indispensable. But for the solicitation of his associates he would have resigned in January.

headline.main: NEW-YORK UNIVERSITY.; R. P. Whipple and Rev. John Plerpent.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. E. P. WHIPPLE discoursed last evening before the Literary Societies of the University. His theme was the "Means and Conditions of Intellectual Success." The Oration was a fine pieco of reasoning, and had a great deal of common sense in it.
docs.snippet: Mr. E. P. WHIPPLE discoursed last evening before the Literary Societies of the University. His theme was the "Means and Conditions of Intellectual Success." The Oration was a fine pieco of reasoning, and had a great deal of common sense in it.

headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; BOARD OF HEALTH. MORTALITY.

docs.lead_paragraph: BOARD OF HEALTH.--Monday.--Present, Alderman MORRIS.--The Second District Health Warden reported Little-street, from Water to the East River, to be in a filthy condition; also, Marshall-street, from Gold to Little-street; also, John-street, from Little to Bridge-street; also, sink of No. 12 Water-street. Usual notice to abate.

headline.main: FOUR DAYS 'LATER FROM EUROPE; ARRIVAL OF THE BALTIC. PACIFIC ASPECT OF THE TURKISH QUESTION. INTERESTING DEBATES IN PARLIAMENT. MARKET INTELLIGENCE, &c. THE TURKISH QUESTION Latest Intelligence through the English Press Action of England and France. Debute In Parliament. In the House of Commons--The Turkish Question. The Emperor's Intentions. The Turkish Question In Paris--The Czar a the Emperor. The Actio of England and France on the Turkish Question. Effect of a War on Russia. GREAT BRITAIN. Interesting Debates in Parliament--South Carolina called to account--the Cuban Slave Trade--Entertainment to Commodore Vanderbilt--the late fraud on Duncan, Sherman & Co. Table Talk. Cuba and the Slave Trade. Entertainment to Commodore Vanderbilt. The State of Trade in Paris. The New-York Exhibition--A Growl from John Ball. FRANCE. The Public Mind Tranquilized on the Eastern Question--More Imaginary Plots--An Imperial Commissioner to New-York--Flourishing Condition of the Bank of France. Later. SPAIN AND PORTUGAL. ITALY. AUSTRIA. RUSSIA. GREECE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail Steamship Baltic left Liverpool on Wednesday, Jan. 12, at 3 P. M. From Tory Island to Cape Race, experienced a succession of strong westerly winds and rough sea. On the 18th, 19th, 22nd and 23d inst., encountered hard gales and heavy head sea from the W. S. W. The Baltic brought the following passengers:

docs.lead_paragraph: The good man has gone. A dispatch received this morning, by his family, announces that Rev. Dr. SHARP last evening, at 7 o'clock, at the residence of ROBT. P. BROWN Esq., in Stoneley, a village about six miles from Baltimore, where he had gone, hoping that a change of climate and scenery. might be of benefit to his fast failing health. The deceased was 69 years of age on the 25th of December last.

headline.main: The Latest Aspect of the Turkish Question.

docs.lead_paragraph: The oscillations of suspense are much more strongly felt by our neighbors, the French, than by ourselves, and accordingly we were prepared for the violent alternations of hope and apprehension on the Eastern question which are conveyed to us from day to day by the telegraph from Paris.

headline.main: PUBIIC PARKS.; REPORT OF TIIE SELECT COMMIITTEE UPON Public Parks in the City of New-York.

headline.main: Condition of the Streets--Care of the Public Health.

docs.lead_paragraph: If a man violates the laws of nature and of health, he very properly expects to suffer for it. If he commits some gross violation, and and is none the worse for it, he grows skeptical about the penalty, does it again, and learns at last by experience what he would not learn from a cheaper teacher.
docs.snippet: If a man violates the laws of nature and of health, he very properly expects to suffer for it. If he commits some gross violation, and and is none the worse for it, he grows skeptical about the penalty, does it again, and learns at last by experience...

headline.main: HOW TO VISIT NEW-YORK AND See the Crystal Palace.; NUMBER ONE. How to get here--Preparations for coming--How prudent Ladies will dress--How the student and the nice man will prepare--Who takes the little carpet bag--Who takes a trunk, and why a man should take his wife--The grumbler and the cheerful traveler--The City looms up.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is a World's Fair that is to be opened in the Crystal Palace on the fifteenth of July; and the world means to see it as it should. Not that all the world will be there--the beautiful building scareely accommodate them.
docs.snippet: It is a World's Fair that is to be opened in the Crystal Palace on the fifteenth of July; and the world means to see it as it should. Not that all the world will be there--the beautiful building scareely accommodate them.
